alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 4:01AM EDT until August 31 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Osceola. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated torrential rain bands form Hurricane Idalia moving rapidly across Osceola and Orange Counties. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch or so are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, Wedgefield, Windermere, Bay Lake, Buena Ventura Lakes, East Lake Toho, West Lake Toho, Narcoossee, Orlando International Airport, Intercession City, Oak Ridge, Conway, Celebration, Azalea Park, Avalon Park, Bithlo, Poinciana and Belle Isle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
